Under (at least) J2SDK 1.4, you can pass an instance of PrintStream to
Syst=
em.setOut(), .setErr(), and .setIn(). For instance, you can do the
followin=
g to capture stdout and stderr:
 
[...]
public void testMyTest() throws Exc=
eption {
  ByteArrayOutputStream stdout =3D new ByteArrayOutputStream();
  =
ByteArrayOutputStream stderr =3D new ByteArrayOutputStream();
  System.setO=
ut(stdout);
  System.setErr(stderr);
  [...]
}
[...]

Replace ByteArrayOutp=
utStream with FileOutputStream to print to a file.
I haven't checked, but t=
his probably works with JDK 1.3 as well.

I use this when an external frame=
work I am using decides to print
information I don't need at test time or i=
f I am writing a console based
program and want to check the output.

any ideas how to do this?
